title.narrative: Joint Global Programme on Access to Controlled Medicines

description.narrative: With this Joint Global Programme on access to controlled medicines, the UNODC aims to lead a coordinated worldwide response of member states, to improve the management policies and procedures related to access to controlled drugs, particularly pain medication, for medical purposes. Australia's contribution of AUD$100,000 will go towards the overall objective of the programme to increase access to controlled drugs for medical purposes, while simultaneously controlling for abuse and diversion. As such, this will increase the number of patients globally receiving appropriate treatment for conditions requiring the use of such medication.

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade

organisation.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
